data.neighbors

Class SharedNeighborFinder

  • java.lang.Object
    • data.neighbors.SharedNeighborFinder
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.io.Serializable

    public class SharedNeighborFinder
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.io.Serializable
    This class calculates the kNN set intersections between different points in order to later calculate shared-neighbor similarity/dissimilarity measures. These secondary measures are often better suited for high-dimensional data than the primary metrics.
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

      void obtainWeightsFromBadHubness()
      Elements that occur in neighbor sets between several categories are going to have their weights reduced down, thereby increasing intraclass similarity and decreasing interclass similarity.

      • SharedNeighborFinder

        public SharedNeighborFinder(DataSet dset,
                    int k,
                    CombinedMetric cmet,
                    int kClassification)
        Parameters:
        dset - DataSet that is being analyzed.
        k - Neighborhood size for shared-neighbor calculation.
        cmet - CombinedMetric object for primary distances.
        kClassification - Neighborhood size used for classification.

      • SharedNeighborFinder

        public SharedNeighborFinder(DataSet dset,
                    int k,
                    CombinedMetric cmet)
        Parameters:
        dset - DataSet that is being analyzed.
        k - Neighborhood size for shared-neighbor calculation.
        cmet - CombinedMetric object for primary distances.

      • SharedNeighborFinder

        public SharedNeighborFinder(NeighborSetFinder nsf)
        Parameters:
        nsf - NeighborSetFinder containing the kNN information.

      • SharedNeighborFinder

        public SharedNeighborFinder(NeighborSetFinder nsf,
                    int kClassification)
        Parameters:
        nsf - NeighborSetFinder containing the kNN information.
        kClassification - Neighborhood size that will be later used in classification. It is sometimes used for finding instance weights. The k that will be used for shared-neighbor calculations is extracted from the NeighborSetFinder object instead.

        public void setKClassification(int kClassification)
        Parameters:
        kClassification - Neighborhood size that will be later used in classification. It is sometimes used for finding instance weights.

      • getSharedNeighborCounts

        public float[][] getSharedNeighborCounts()
        Returns:
        A float matrix that has stores the counts of shared neighbors between pairs of points. It is symmetric, so we use the upper diagonal form, where each row stores only d(i, j) for i > j.

      • getCombinedMetric

        public CombinedMetric getCombinedMetric()
        Returns:
        CombinedMetric object for primary distance calculations.

      • getData

        public DataSet getData()
        Returns:
        DataSet that is being analyzed.

      • getSNK

        public int getSNK()
        Returns:
        Integer that is the neighborhood size that will be used in shared-neighbor calculations.

      • obtainWeightsFromGeneralHubness

        public void obtainWeightsFromGeneralHubness()
        Elements that are hubs contribute less to similarity between other points when found as shared neighbors.

      • obtainWeightsFromBadHubness

        public void obtainWeightsFromBadHubness()
        Elements that occur in neighbor sets between several categories are going to have their weights reduced down, thereby increasing intraclass similarity and decreasing interclass similarity.

      • obtainWeightsFromHubnessInformation

        public void obtainWeightsFromHubnessInformation(float theta)
        Get the overall hubness information instance weighting scheme.
        Parameters:
        theta - The tradeoff parameter.

      • obtainWeightsFromHubnessInformation

        public void obtainWeightsFromHubnessInformation()
        Get the overall hubness information instance weighting scheme while using default tradeoff.

        Returns:

        public void removeWeights()

      • countSharedNeighborsWithRespectToDataset

        public float countSharedNeighborsWithRespectToDataset(DataInstance instanceFirst,
                                             DataInstance instanceSecond,
                                             int[] kNeighborsFirst,
                                             int[] kNeighborsSecond)
                                               throws java.lang.Exception
        Counts the number of shared k-nearest neighbors between the two points.
        Parameters:
        instanceFirst - First DataInstance.
        instanceSecond - Second DataInstance.
        kNeighborsFirst - Integer array as the kNN set of the first data instance.
        kNeighborsSecond - Integer array as the kNN set of the second data instance.
        Returns:
        Float that is the weighted shared-neighbor count between the two instances.
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception

      • countSharedNeighborsWithRespectToDataset

        public float countSharedNeighborsWithRespectToDataset(DataInstance instanceFirst,
                                             DataInstance instanceSecond,
                                             java.util.HashMap<java.lang.Integer,java.lang.Object> neighborHashFirst,
                                             java.util.HashMap<java.lang.Integer,java.lang.Object> neighborHashSecond)
                                               throws java.lang.Exception
        Counts the number of shared k-nearest neighbors between the two points.
        Parameters:
        instanceFirst - First DataInstance.
        instanceSecond - Second DataInstance.
        neighborHashFirst - HashMap that has k-neighbors of the first instance as keys.
        neighborHashSecond - HashMap that has k-neighbors of the second instance as keys.
        Returns:
        Float that is the weighted shared-neighbor count between the two instances.
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception

      • countSharedNeighborsWithRespectToDataset

        public float countSharedNeighborsWithRespectToDataset(DataInstance instanceFirst,
                                             DataInstance instanceSecond,
                                             float[] distToDataFromFirst,
                                             int[] kNeighborsSecond)
                                               throws java.lang.Exception
        Counts the number of shared k-nearest neighbors between the two points.
        Parameters:
        instanceFirst - First DataInstance.
        instanceSecond - Second DataInstance.
        distToDataFromFirst - Float array representing the distances from the first data instance to the training data points.
        kNeighborsSecond - Integer array as the kNN set of the second data instance.
        Returns:
        Float that is the weighted shared-neighbor count between the two instances.
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception

      • getCountOfSharedNeighborsFor

        public float getCountOfSharedNeighborsFor(int firstIndex,
                                 int secondIndex)
        Gets the count of shared neighbors for an index pair, according to previous calculations.
        Parameters:
        firstIndex - Index of the first data instance.
        secondIndex - Index of the second data instance.
        Returns:
        The count of shared neighbors between the two.

        secondIndex - Index of the second data instance.
